question: Are the mountains known as Trivor and The Crown both found in Asia?

nodes.instruction: Identify the continent where Trivor mountain is located.
nodes.output: Trivor mountain is located in the continent of Asia, specifically in the Gilgit-Baltistan region of Pakistan. It is part of the Hispar Muztagh subrange of the Karakoram range.

nodes.instruction: Identify the continent where The Crown mountain is located.
nodes.output: The Crown mountain is located in the continent of Asia, specifically in the Karakoram mountain range in the Xinjiang Uyghur Autonomous Region of China.

nodes.instruction: Determine if Trivor is located in Asia.
nodes.output: Trivor is located in Asia, specifically in the Gilgit-Baltistan region of Pakistan.

nodes.instruction: Determine if The Crown is located in Asia.
nodes.output: The Crown mountain is located in Asia, specifically in the Karakoram mountain range in the Xinjiang Uyghur Autonomous Region of China. Therefore, The Crown is indeed located in Asia.

nodes.instruction: Conclude whether both Trivor and The Crown are found in Asia based on the previous verifications.
nodes.output: Based on the previous verifications, both Trivor and The Crown are found in Asia. Trivor is located in the Gilgit-Baltistan region of Pakistan, and The Crown mountain is located in the Karakoram mountain range in the Xinjiang Uyghur Autonomous Region of China. Therefore, both mountains are situated in Asia.

retrieved_passages:
The Crown (mountain)
The Crown, also known as Huang Guan Shan and sometimes Crown Peak, is a mountain in the Karakoram mountain range in China. It is located in the Xinjiang Uyghur Autonomous Region of China. Its summit has an elevation of 7295 m and it is the highest peak in the Yengisogat subrange of the Karakoram.

Momhil Sar
Momhil Sar, or Mumhail Sar as pronounced in Wakhi is at 7343 m above sea level, is the 64th highest mountain peak in the world. Mumhail Sar in Wakhi means the mountain that overlooks or is above Grandmother's cattle pen or paddock. It is situated in the Hispar Muztagh subrange of the Karakoram range, a few kilometres to the north-west of its parent peak Trivor.

Trivor
Trivor (Urdu: ترِووُر‎ ) is one of the high peaks of the Hispar Muztagh, a subrange of the Karakoram range in the Gilgit-Baltistan of Pakistan.

Llamayuq Q'asa
Llamayuq Q'asa (Quechua "llama" llama, "-yuq" a suffix, "Llamayuq" an archaeological site, "q'asa" mountain pass, "Llamayuq pass" or "mountain pass with llamas", also spelled "Llamayojcasa, Llamayoqccasa"), also known as Qucha Quyllur ("Qochaqollur", "lake star"), is a mountain in the eastern extensions of the Urupampa mountain range in the Andes of Peru, about 4600 m high. It is located in the Cusco Region, Calca Province, Calca District. It lies southeast of Q'irayuq. This is where the archaeological site of Llamayuq is situated.

Mingli Sar
Mingli Sar is a mountain located in the Shimshal valley in Gilgit-Baltistan, Pakistan. The mountain, located in the Karakoram mountain range, is 6050 meters high and located at the southernmost part of the Pamir mountain range. It was first climbed in 1988 by the famous Pakistani climber Nazir Sabir. Shimshal lake sits at the base of the mountain. China is located to the north, while to the left is the Hindukush mountain range. K2 is located on the south eastern side of the valley.

Yengisogat
The Yengisogat range (音苏盖提 ), also known as the Wesm Mountains, is a Chinese subrange of the Karakoram mountain range. It lies north of the Baltoro Muztagh, home of the eight-thousanders of the Karakoram. The highest peak is Huangguan Shan, or Crown Peak, 7,265 m (23,835 ft) (also sometimes given as 7,295 m/23,934 ft).

Stone Mountain, Georgia
Stone Mountain is a city in DeKalb County, Georgia, United States. The population was 5,802 at the 2010 census. Stone Mountain is located in the eastern part of Dekalb County and is a suburb of Atlanta. It lies near to but does not include the geological formation Stone Mountain.

Kezhen Peak
Kezhen Peak, also known as Karpogo Sar, is a mountain in the Karakoram mountain range. It is located in the Xinjiang Autonomous Region of China.

Bromley Mountain
Bromley Mountain is located in southern Vermont, United States and is part of the Green Mountains. It is located in Bennington County, seven miles (11 km) east of Manchester, Vermont and just west of Peru, Vermont. It is a popular destination for skiing and snowboarding.

Yanajirca (Huallanca)
Yanajirca or Yana Hirka (Quechua "yana" black, Ancash Quechua "hirka" mountain, "black mountain", also spelled "Yanajirca") is a mountain in the Andes of Peru which reaches an altitude of approximately 4600 m . It is located in the Ancash Region, Bolognesi Province, Huallanca District. Yana Hirka lies southeast of the Wallanka mountain range.

retrieved_passages:
The Crown (mountain)
The Crown, also known as Huang Guan Shan and sometimes Crown Peak, is a mountain in the Karakoram mountain range in China. It is located in the Xinjiang Uyghur Autonomous Region of China. Its summit has an elevation of 7295 m and it is the highest peak in the Yengisogat subrange of the Karakoram.

Momhil Sar
Momhil Sar, or Mumhail Sar as pronounced in Wakhi is at 7343 m above sea level, is the 64th highest mountain peak in the world. Mumhail Sar in Wakhi means the mountain that overlooks or is above Grandmother's cattle pen or paddock. It is situated in the Hispar Muztagh subrange of the Karakoram range, a few kilometres to the north-west of its parent peak Trivor.

Trivor
Trivor (Urdu: ترِووُر‎ ) is one of the high peaks of the Hispar Muztagh, a subrange of the Karakoram range in the Gilgit-Baltistan of Pakistan.

Llamayuq Q'asa
Llamayuq Q'asa (Quechua "llama" llama, "-yuq" a suffix, "Llamayuq" an archaeological site, "q'asa" mountain pass, "Llamayuq pass" or "mountain pass with llamas", also spelled "Llamayojcasa, Llamayoqccasa"), also known as Qucha Quyllur ("Qochaqollur", "lake star"), is a mountain in the eastern extensions of the Urupampa mountain range in the Andes of Peru, about 4600 m high. It is located in the Cusco Region, Calca Province, Calca District. It lies southeast of Q'irayuq. This is where the archaeological site of Llamayuq is situated.

Mingli Sar
Mingli Sar is a mountain located in the Shimshal valley in Gilgit-Baltistan, Pakistan. The mountain, located in the Karakoram mountain range, is 6050 meters high and located at the southernmost part of the Pamir mountain range. It was first climbed in 1988 by the famous Pakistani climber Nazir Sabir. Shimshal lake sits at the base of the mountain. China is located to the north, while to the left is the Hindukush mountain range. K2 is located on the south eastern side of the valley.

Yengisogat
The Yengisogat range (音苏盖提 ), also known as the Wesm Mountains, is a Chinese subrange of the Karakoram mountain range. It lies north of the Baltoro Muztagh, home of the eight-thousanders of the Karakoram. The highest peak is Huangguan Shan, or Crown Peak, 7,265 m (23,835 ft) (also sometimes given as 7,295 m/23,934 ft).

Stone Mountain, Georgia
Stone Mountain is a city in DeKalb County, Georgia, United States. The population was 5,802 at the 2010 census. Stone Mountain is located in the eastern part of Dekalb County and is a suburb of Atlanta. It lies near to but does not include the geological formation Stone Mountain.

Kezhen Peak
Kezhen Peak, also known as Karpogo Sar, is a mountain in the Karakoram mountain range. It is located in the Xinjiang Autonomous Region of China.

Bromley Mountain
Bromley Mountain is located in southern Vermont, United States and is part of the Green Mountains. It is located in Bennington County, seven miles (11 km) east of Manchester, Vermont and just west of Peru, Vermont. It is a popular destination for skiing and snowboarding.

Yanajirca (Huallanca)
Yanajirca or Yana Hirka (Quechua "yana" black, Ancash Quechua "hirka" mountain, "black mountain", also spelled "Yanajirca") is a mountain in the Andes of Peru which reaches an altitude of approximately 4600 m . It is located in the Ancash Region, Bolognesi Province, Huallanca District. Yana Hirka lies southeast of the Wallanka mountain range.
